item.title: Windows Subsystem For Linux
item.description: title: author: mbaggett date: 2023-10-01 20:55:00 +0800 categories: [Introduction] tags: [Linux, WSL, WSL2, Windows] pin: true search: include Over the past two years years Microsoft has made some significant improvements to the Windows Subsystem for Linux. The Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) is a feature of the Windows operating system that enables you to run a Linux file system, along with Linux command-line tools and GUI apps, directly on Windows, alongside your traditional Windows desktop and apps.
